verses.textEn: And he showed me the river of the water of life, shining like crystal, proceeding from the throne of God and of the Lamb.
verses.textLa: Et ostendit mihi fluvium aquæ vitæ, splendidum tamquam crystallum, procedentem de sede Dei et Agni.

verses.textEn: In the midst of its main street, and on both sides of the river, was the Tree of Life, bearing twelve fruits, offering one fruit for each month, and the leaves of the tree are for the health of the nations.
verses.textLa: In medio plateæ eius, et ex utraque parte fluminis lignum vitæ, afferens fructus duodecim, per menses singulos reddens fructum suum, et folia ligni ad sanitatem Gentium.
verses.notes: The text literally says ‘for each month offering its fruit,’ but the meaning is that of one fruit per month, 12 fruits, one per month. And health is not merely healing of disease or injury; health can refer to what which prevents disease or injury, or to that which maintains health.

verses.textEn: And every curse shall be no more. But the throne of God and of the Lamb will be in it, and his servants shall serve him.
verses.textLa: Et omne maledictum non erit amplius: sed sedes Dei, et Agni in illa erunt, et servi eius servient illi.

verses.textEn: And they shall see his face. And his name shall be on their foreheads.
verses.textLa: Et videbunt faciem eius: et nomen eius in frontibus eorum.

verses.textEn: And night shall be no more. And they will not need the light of a lamp, nor the light of the sun, because the Lord God will illuminate them. And they shall reign forever and ever.
verses.textLa: Et nox ultra non erit: et non egebunt lumine lucernæ, neque lumine solis, quoniam Dominus Deus illuminabit illos, et regnabunt in sæcula sæculorum.

verses.textEn: And he said to me: “These words are entirely faithful and true.” And the Lord, the God of the spirits of the prophets, sent his Angel to reveal to his servant what must occur soon:
verses.textLa: Et dixit mihi: Hæc verba fidelissima sunt, et vera. Et Dominus Deus spirituum prophetarum misit Angelum suum ostendere servis suis quæ oportet fieri cito.

verses.textEn: “For behold, I am approaching quickly! Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.”
verses.textLa: Et ecce venio velociter. Beatus, qui custodit verba prophetiæ libri huius.

verses.textEn: And I, John, heard and saw these things. And, after I had heard and seen, I fell down, so as to adore before the feet of the Angel, who was revealing these things to me.
verses.textLa: Et ego Ioannes, qui audivi, et vidi hæc. Et postquam audissem, et vidissem, cecidi ut adorarem ante pedes Angeli, qui mihi hæc ostendebat:

verses.textEn: And he said to me: “Be careful not to do so. For I am your fellow servant, and I am among your brothers the prophets, and among those who keep the words of the prophecy of this book. Adore God.”
verses.textLa: et dixit mihi: Vide ne feceris: conservus enim tuus sum, et fratrum tuorum prophetarum, et eorum, qui servant verba prophetiæ libri huius: Deum adora.

verses.textEn: And he said to me: “Do not seal the words of the prophecy of this book. For the time is near.
verses.textLa: Et dicit mihi: Ne signaveris verba prophetiæ libri huius: tempus enim prope est.

verses.textEn: Whoever does harm, he might still do harm. And whoever is filthy, he might still be filthy. And whoever is just, he may still be just. And one who is holy, he may still be holy.”
verses.textLa: Qui nocet, noceat adhuc: et qui in sordibus est, sordescat adhuc: et qui iustus est, iustificetur adhuc: et sanctus, sanctificetur adhuc.

verses.textEn: “Behold, I am approaching quickly! And my repayment is with me, to render to each one according to his works.
verses.textLa: Ecce venio cito, et merces mea mecum est, reddere unicuique secundum opera sua.

verses.textEn: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last, the Beginning and the End.”
verses.textLa: Ego sum α, et ω, primus, et novissimus, principium, et finis.

verses.textEn: Blessed are those who wash their robes in the blood of the Lamb. So may they have a right to the tree of life; so may they enter through the gates into the City.
verses.textLa: Beati, qui lavant stolas suas in sanguine Agni: ut sit potestas eorum in ligno vitæ, et per portas intrent in civitatem.

verses.textEn: Outside are dogs, and drug abusers, and the unchaste, and murderers, and those who serve idols, and all who love and do what is false.
verses.textLa: Foris canes, et venefici, et impudici, et homicidæ, et idolis servientes, et omnis, qui amat, et facit mendacium.
verses.notes: The word ‘venefici’ literally, in ancient times, referred to those who engaged in magical or occult practices, including mixing various potions, drugs, and poisons; it also was used to refer to those who made poisons, and to those who made drugs of various kinds. In the modern context, this term has little meaning if translated as ‘sorcerers.’ It is best translated by reference to those persons in modern times who use, promote, or distribute immoral drugs (legal or illegal), such as: chemical contraceptives, drugs of abuse, recreational drugs, abuse of prescription drugs, etc.

verses.textEn: “I, Jesus, have sent my Angel, to testify to these things for you among the Churches. I am the Root and the Origin of David, the bright morning Star.”
verses.textLa: Ego Iesus misi Angelum meum, testificari vobis hæc in Ecclesiis. Ego sum radix, et genus David, stella splendida, et matutina.

verses.textEn: And the Spirit and the Bride say: “Draw near.” And whoever hears, let him say: “Draw near.” And whoever thirsts, let him draw near. And whoever is willing, let him accept the water of life, freely.
verses.textLa: Et spiritus, et sponsa dicunt: Veni. Et qui audit, dicat: Veni. Et qui sitit, veniat: et qui vult, accipiat aquam vitæ, gratis.

verses.textEn: For I call as witnesses all listeners of the words of the prophecy of this book. If anyone will have added to these, God will add upon him the afflictions written in this book.
verses.textLa: Contestor enim omni audienti verba prophetiæ libri huius: Si quis apposuerit ad hæc, apponet Deus super illum plagas scriptas in libro isto.

verses.textEn: And if anyone will have taken away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God will take away his portion from the Book of Life, and from the Holy City, and from these things which have been written in this book.
verses.textLa: Et si quis diminuerit de verbis libri prophetiæ huius, auferet Deus partem eius de libro vitæ, et de civitate sancta, et de his, quæ scripta sunt in libro isto.

verses.textEn: He who offers testimony to these things, says: “Even now, I am approaching quickly.” Amen. Come, Lord Jesus.
verses.textLa: Dicit qui testimonium perhibet istorum. Etiam venio cito: Amen. Veni Domine Iesu.
verses.notes: It is not entirely clear in this passage when it is the Angel speaking, when it is Christ speaking, and when it is John writing.

verses.textEn: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
verses.textLa: Gratia Domini nostri Iesu Christi cum omnibus vobis. Amen.
